trans-unit.source: Setting the default connection access mode

seg-source.mrk: Setting the default connection access mode

target.mrk: Setting the default connection access mode

trans-unit.source: You can use the <codeph>derby.database.defaultConnectionMode</codeph> property to specify the default type of access that users have when they connect to the database.

seg-source.mrk: You can use the <codeph>derby.database.defaultConnectionMode</codeph> property to specify the default type of access that users have when they connect to the database.

target.mrk: You can use the <codeph>derby.database.defaultConnectionMode</codeph> property to specify the default type of access that users have when they connect to the database.

trans-unit.source: If you use SQL authorization (the default with NATIVE authentication), you typically do not use this property.

seg-source.mrk: If you use SQL authorization (the default with NATIVE authentication), you typically do not use this property.

target.mrk: If you use SQL authorization (the default with NATIVE authentication), you typically do not use this property.

trans-unit.source: The valid settings for the <codeph>derby.database.defaultConnectionMode</codeph> property are:

seg-source.mrk: The valid settings for the <codeph>derby.database.defaultConnectionMode</codeph> property are:

target.mrk: The valid settings for the <codeph>derby.database.defaultConnectionMode</codeph> property are:

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify a setting for the <codeph>derby.database.defaultConnectionMode</codeph> property, the default access setting is <varname>fullAccess</varname>.

seg-source.mrk: If you do not specify a setting for the <codeph>derby.database.defaultConnectionMode</codeph> property, the default access setting is <varname>fullAccess</varname>.

target.mrk: If you do not specify a setting for the <codeph>derby.database.defaultConnectionMode</codeph> property, the default access setting is <varname>fullAccess</varname>.

trans-unit.source: To set the default connection access mode, specify the access in a CALL statement. For example:

seg-source.mrk: To set the default connection access mode, specify the access in a CALL statement.

target.mrk: To set the default connection access mode, specify the access in a CALL statement.

trans-unit.source: To specify read-write access for the system administrator userID <codeph>sa</codeph> and the read-only as the default access for anyone else who connects to the database, issue these CALL statements:
